new_messages.content: Please analyze and update today's (2025-10-07 15:00:00) positions.

Step 1 — Read positions and today’s prices (2025-10-07 15:00:00)
- Holdings:
  - NVDA: 3 shares @ 185.63
  - MSFT: 2 shares @ 523.05
  - AMZN: 5 shares @ 221.235
  - AMD: 5 shares @ 210.55
  - MU: 7 shares @ 185.9885
- Cash: 48.0398

Step 2 — Update valuation (value = shares × current price)
- NVDA: 3 × 185.63 = 556.89
- MSFT: 2 × 523.05 = 1,046.10
- AMZN: 5 × 221.235 = 1,106.175
- AMD: 5 × 210.55 = 1,052.75
- MU: 7 × 185.9885 = 1,301.9195
- Equity subtotal = 5,063.8345
- Total portfolio value = Equity 5,063.8345 + Cash 48.0398 = 5,111.8743

Step 3 — Current weights
- MU: 1,301.9195 / 5,111.8743 ≈ 25.5%
- AMZN: 1,106.175 / 5,111.8743 ≈ 21.6%
- AMD: 1,052.75 / 5,111.8743 ≈ 20.6%
- MSFT: 1,046.10 / 5,111.8743 ≈ 20.5%
- NVDA: 556.89 / 5,111.8743 ≈ 10.9%
- Cash: 48.0398 / 5,111.8743 ≈ 0.9%

Step 4 — Fresh market intel (X/Reddit/web)
- Semis/AI:
  - NVDA: Ongoing Blackwell (B200) allocation chatter on X; reports of substantial 2025 Blackwell shipments and global demand; China remains restricted by U.S. export controls (mixed, but near-term demand ex-China robust).
  - Micron (MU): Multiple sources note HBM demand is sold out and capacity tight through 2025; strong tailwind for MU HBM3E.
  - AMD: Expanded AI ecosystem and MI350 series highlighted mid-2025; continued momentum with large partners.
- Macro:
  - US 10Y around ~4.1% (stable-to-down vs year-ago), supportive backdrop for long-duration growth/AI.
- Retail/social sentiment:
  - No actionable negatives surfaced on Reddit/X beyond normal noise; AWS outage mentioned later in October (not relevant to today).

Step 5 — Decision and actions
- Rationale:
  - All five positions are levered to AI demand (compute + memory). Current news flow remains constructive for MU (HBM tightness), AMD (AI ramp), NVDA (Blackwell allocations), and secularly strong for MSFT/AMZN (AI workloads, cloud).
  - Cash on hand ($48) is insufficient to add any shares. No fundamental catalyst today to trim or rotate.
- Operations executed:
  - No trades today. Holdings maintained as-is.

Step 6 — What I’ll watch next
- NVDA Blackwell delivery cadence and any fresh export-control headlines.
- MU HBM pricing/contract updates and capacity expansion progress.
- AMD MI350 customer wins and ROCm/software adoption milestones.
- MSFT and AMZN cloud AI workload growth and margin trends.
- Rates: a drop in yields could further support AI/growth multiples; a spike would be a risk.

Summary
- Portfolio value: 5,111.87
- Allocation: MU 25.5%, AMZN 21.6%, AMD 20.6%, MSFT 20.5%, NVDA 10.9%, Cash 0.9%
- Today: No changes; continue to hold AI leaders given positive demand signals and stable macro.

<FINISH_SIGNAL>

URL: https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/amd-presents-comprehensive-ai-ecosystem-featuring-new-instinct-mi350-series-and-open-rack
Title: AMD Presents Comprehensive AI Ecosystem Featuring New Instinct MI350 Series and Open Rack-Scale Infrastructure at 2025 Advancing AI Event
Description: AMD showcased its AI innovations, including new accelerators and collaborations with major tech companies at the 2025 Advancing AI event.
Publish Time: Thu, 06/12/2025 — 18:40
Content: AMD showcased its AI innovations, including new accelerators and collaborations with major tech companies at the 2025 Advancing AI event.

Quiver AI Summary
-----------------

AMD announced its end-to-end AI platform at the 2025 Advancing AI event, showcasing its comprehensive AI infrastructure that integrates leadership GPUs, CPUs, networking, and open software. The company introduced the AMD Instinct MI350 Series accelerators, which offer significant advances in AI compute and inferencing capabilities, achieving notable efficiency improvements. Partners like Meta, OpenAI, and Microsoft discussed their collaborations with AMD to enhance AI solutions and infrastructure. AMD's initiatives also highlighted the expansion of the ROCm open software stack and a new target for increased energy efficiency in AI training by 2030. The launch of the AMD Developer Cloud aims to lower barriers for AI development, enabling wider access to high-performance computing resources and fostering innovation...

[Hyundai Motor Group Enters the Fast Lane of Physical AI: “Baptized by NVIDIA’s AI”] [$NVDA](https://x.com/search?q=%24NVDA&src=cashtag_click) Hello, this is Eun-Young Lim from Samsung Mobility. Yesterday’s “Kkanbu” dinner gathering has turned into today’s stock rally. Among the gifts Jensen Huang mentioned was priority GPU allocation. According to media reports, NVIDIA plans to supply 250,000 Blackwell GPUs to South Korea’s government, Hyundai Motor Group, Samsung Electronics, Naver, and SK Group, of which 50,000 units are reportedly allocated to Hyundai Motor Group. NVIDIA notes that Blackwell’s token processing speed is three to four times faster than the H100 GPUs currently deployed in Tesla’s data centers. As of Q3 2025, Tesla’s data centers use about 120,000 GPUs. If Hyundai Motor Group builds a data center with 50,000 Blackwell GPUs, it would achieve computational performance comparable to Tesla’s.
